title: My Friend Got Banned for "Scripting" RIOT PLS RESPOND
body:

At first I was astounded as he kinda sucked (no offense to him) and he stayed bronze the whole time (as far as I can remember). His summoner name is Naruto78k and I would like it if riot gave responded with proof that he was scripting not just an email saying "you did use scripts". And for all the people in the comments who are gunna reply that im just trying to relieve the ban, I smurfed in bronze and although some players said I was using scripts, (happened when I was playing kat against a yasuo one time) nothing happened (and I played a decent, good amount on my smurf). The problem is, I know he isn't really good and its kinda stupid you rioters banned a bronzie like him instead of focusing on people who actually use scripts (you should check more reports in bronze as refer to scripts of anyone who outplays or beats them). replies.body: They won't be able to tell him what they found because it lets people know how they got caught and what they can get away with, which only enables the cheaters even more. If your friend has been using someone else's computer, or let anyone else play, it's possible an illegal program was being used without his knowledge.

As far as I know, he doesn't usually let people go on his account. He sometimes calls me an addict when I brag about my rank to him so he's not someone who cares to be in gold (even doe the ranked rewards are quite nice).

His smurf is still bronze 4 and tbh, scripting and use of illegal programming just to succeed in video games is kinda sad. It gives you no sense of achievement. Additionally, he is in the top maths and science class so he doesn't have much time to be messing around with illegal programming (dunno much but scripts seem pretty annoying to download and set up).

It doesn't have to have been a script, it could have been a disallowed third party program. Even programs that people use to say apply map skins or the like can contain disallowed features, and thus will trigger an immediate ban, regardless of whether said feature was being used or not. The email with the reason for the ban usually says something along the lines of "Banned for using scripts, hacks, cheats or third party programs" or something to that effect.

There are also some things that can cause false positives, but if Support has gotten back to him confirming it then it means they have seen he is using a modified client/3rd party program/script/hack/cheat etc of some kind. If he still wishes to appeal he can send support a log of all programs running while he is playing League and they can check for false positives.
well yeh, any modifying (public) to the game is not allowed in league, I know that. Riot has a sense of security to their game too

In the end only he knows what he's used and if he can take it up with support or not. That's just the most common thing that I've seen, is that people will focus on the fact that it says scripting when the ban was for third party stuff.
No worries, if you get any more info that you think is relevant feel free to let us know, there's not all that much we can do here other than tell him to keep working with support.
My friend already logged off, ill tell him to send a ticket to player support or ill do it for him tomorrow. He's got nearly no champs on his smurf
He really should do it himself, since he has all the info, but I think that's a good plan for now :)

He did it already, that's why I mentioned riot's response was just "you did use scripts". Sounds like lame excuse to me (how riot aint revealing any information at all) as I know he definitely know he wasn't using scripts or anything of that matter
